meanings.definition: The quality or state of being very talkative or chatty.
meanings.sent1: Her loquacity during the meeting made it hard for others to share their thoughts.
meanings.sent2: His loquacity at the party entertained everyone with his stories.
meanings.sent3: Despite her loquacity, she was a great listener when her friends needed to talk.
meanings.sent4: The loquacity of the river as it flowed through the valley was calming to the hikers.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's loquacity in explaining the lesson helped the students understand it better.

meanings.sent1: The loquacity of the politician's speech bored the audience.
meanings.sent2: His loquacity in emails often led to misunderstandings due to the excessive details.
meanings.sent3: The loquacity of the cat meowing for food was both annoying and endearing.
meanings.sent4: The loquacity of the storm outside matched the intensity of the argument inside.
meanings.sent5: The loquacity of the book's description painted a vivid picture in the reader's mind.
